column4: have someone here managed to install cinelerra? How do I know if I'm using a RT Kernel? I'm having problems when trying to install cinelerra...
uname -r will tell yoy the current kernel you use, if it ends in -rt you're on a realtime kernel
yes, I guessed that, thanks. Then I'm not using it
look at akirad.cinelerra.org for a ubuntu repo , the rt kernel you can install via apt-get or synaptic
yeap, I tried follow akirad instructions and repo, but I have problems installing cinelerra. Now I'm trying openmovieeditor, wich also downloaded some files from akirad repo
i see, perhaps it's down .. any specific errors or warnings when trying to install it via apt-get ?
have you tried removing package mpeg3-utils yet ? according to what the paste shows that might conflict with libmpeg3hv-generic from akirad ..
he cannot, let me see the error
let me try to install libmpeg3hv-generic before isntall cinelerra
yeahh, this package is the problem http://paste.ubuntu.com/31953/ I tried to solve it before, but didn't  handle

same error indeed .. perhaps removing mpeg3-utils will let you install it properly, can't tell if that package is a must for you .. looks like something to report at bugs.launchpad.net if it isn't already
thanks for your help, I will try cinelerra later :) I'm off the computer for today. Ciao
I'll see if it's not reported and report it, if in case
